title: Wells Fargo fires 4 senior managers in sales scandal inquiry - ABC News
text: Wells Fargo fires 4 senior managers in sales scandal inquiry By ken sweet, ap business writer NEW YORK Â— Feb 21, 2017, 2:01 PM ET 0 Shares WATCH Wells Fargo Facing Criminal Investigation in California 0 Shares Email Wells Fargo's board of directors said it is firing four senior managers as part of its investigation into the bank's sales practices scandal . The board said Tuesday the four are Claudia Anderson, the former community bank chief risk officer, Pamela Conboy, the lead regional president in Arizona , Shelly Freeman, the former regional president in Los Angeles, and Matthew Raphaelson, head of the community bank's strategy and initiatives. The board said the decision was unanimous. The board also voted to deny any 2016 bonuses to the executives, and they will forfeit any unvested stock and stock options. The San Francisco-based bank has been under fire since it was discovered that employees opened up to 2 million bank and credit card accounts without customer authorization in order to meet lofty sales goals. 0 Shares
